This pr is to fix this bug.

title: [fix](Jdbc Catalog) fix Druid Pool parameter and set `testWhileIdle  = true`
body:
# Proposed changes

Set `testWhileIdle` for the druid pool to true

## Problem summary

If the external data source closes the connection for some reason，but druid still uses this invalid connection. It will cause error:
```
INTERNAL_ERROR]UdfRuntimeException: JDBC executor sql has error:
CAUSED BY: SQLRecoverableException: No more data to read from socket
```

So we set `testWhileIdle = true`

The function of this parameter is: 
When the application obtains a connection from the druid pool, it will check the validity of the connection (provided that the idle time of the connection is longer than `timeBetweenEvictionRunsMillis`).




## Checklist(Required)

title: [docker](hudi) add hudi docker compose
body:
# Proposed changes

Issue Number: close #xxx

## Problem summary

### Add hudi docker compose.

#### 1.Prerequisites
/etc/hosts : The docker compose references many services running in container by the hostname. You had better add the following settings to /etc/hosts

> 127.0.0.1 adhoc-1
127.0.0.1 adhoc-2
127.0.0.1 namenode
127.0.0.1 datanode1
127.0.0.1 hiveserver
127.0.0.1 hivemetastore
127.0.0.1 sparkmaster

#### 2.start docker compose
You can run `${DORIS_HONE}/docker/thirdparties/run-thirdparties-docker.sh -c hudi` to start the hudi container.

> cd doris
./docker/thirdparties/run-thirdparties-docker.sh -c hudi 
...
[+] Running 11/10
 ✔ Container adhoc-1                    Removed                                                                                                                                  10.3s 
 ✔ Container datanode1                  Removed                                                                                                                                  10.4s 
 ✔ Container spark-worker-1             Removed                                                                                                                                   0.0s 
 ✔ Container adhoc-2                    Removed                                                                                                                                  10.3s 
 ✔ Container sparkmaster                Removed                                                                                                                                  10.3s 
 ✔ Container historyserver              Removed                                                                                                                                  10.3s 
 ✔ Container hiveserver                 Removed                                                                                                                                  10.2s 
 ✔ Container hivemetastore              Removed                                                                                                                                   0.6s 
 ✔ Container namenode                   Removed                                                                                                                                  10.3s 
 ✔ Container hive-metastore-postgresql  Removed                                                                                                                                   0.2s 
 ✔ Network hudi_doris--hudi            Removed                                                                                                                                   0.0s 
[+] Running 11/11
 ✔ Network hudi_doris--hudi            Created                                                                                                                                   0.0s 
 ✔ Container hive-metastore-postgresql  Started                                                                                                                                   1.2s 
 ✔ Container namenode                   Started                                                                                                                                   1.3s 
 ✔ Container hivemetastore              Started                                                                                                                                   1.7s 
 ✔ Container historyserver              Started                                                                                                                                   1.8s 
 ✔ Container datanode1                  Started                                                                                                                                   2.3s 
 ✔ Container hiveserver                 Started                                                                                                                                   2.2s 
 ✔ Container sparkmaster                Started                                                                                                                                   2.6s 
 ✔ Container spark-worker-1             Started                                                                                                                                   3.3s 
 ✔ Container adhoc-1                    Started                                                                                                                                   3.5s 
 ✔ Container adhoc-2                    Started                                                                                                                                   3.5s 
...

At this point, the Docker cluster will be up and running. The demo cluster brings up the following services

> HDFS Services (NameNode, DataNode)
> Spark Master and Worker
> Hive Services (Metastore, HiveServer2 along with PostgresDB)
> Adhoc containers to run Hudi/Hive CLI commands

During container startup, `/scripts/setup_demo_container_adhoc_2.sh` will use `/scripts/jar/hoodie-hive-sync-bundle.jar` for hudi data synchronization, which will synchronize data on hdfs to hive with hudi format.

You can also refer to https://hudi.apache.org/docs/quick-start-guide in container  `adhoc-1` to create and write hudi table use spark-sql.

#### 3.Using Doris' catalog
After the container starts, you can create a hudi catalog in doris：
`CREATE CATALOG hudi PROPERTIES (
          'type'='hms',
          'hive.metastore.uris' = 'thrift://localhost:9083',
          'hadoop.username' = 'hive'
);`
then you can query the hudi table.

title: [optimize](parquet-reader) Skip whole row group in the parquet lazy read situation if data has been filtered out.
body:
# Proposed changes

## Problem summary

Close #19038

We found `qt_q11` in regression test `test_external_catalog_hive` is very slow. 
The result is only one record, so other data should be filtered out in the parquet lazy read situation.
Then we found currently the parquet reader read many records because we can only skip parquet page. But in order to skip parquet page, currently we need to read page header, then it will caused prefetch data. Therefore, prefetch data in this case may be not good.

So there are two issues:

1. Skip whole row group in this case.
2. Prefetching data in this case may be not good, need to improve it.

This PR resolve issues 1.
 
### Test result:
Before opt:
```
mysql> select l_quantity from test_external_catalog_hive.tpch_1000_parquet.lineitem where l_orderkey = 599614241 and l_partkey = 59018738 and l_suppkey = 1518744 limit 2;
+------------+
| l_quantity |
+------------+
|      16.00 |
+------------+
1 row in set (2 min 27.55 sec)
```

After opt:
```
mysql> select l_quantity from test_external_catalog_hive.tpch_1000_parquet.lineitem where l_orderkey = 599614241 and l_partkey = 59018738 and l_suppkey = 1518744 limit 2;
+------------+
| l_quantity |
+------------+
|      16.00 |
+------------+
1 row in set (41.95 sec)
```

## Checklist(Required)

* [ ] Does it affect the original behavior
* [ ] Has unit tests been added
* [ ] Has document been added or modified
* [ ] Does it need to update dependencies

title: [Improvement](meta) support return no partition info for show_create_table
body:
Some tables have a mount of partitions, when use show create table stmt on them, you will get so many lines of result that a whole screen cannot  show them all, even if you scroll up to the top.

show create table table2;
| table2 | CREATE TABLE `table2` (
  `k1` int(11) NULL COMMENT 'test column k1',
  `k2` int(11) NULL COMMENT 'test column k2'
) ENGINE=OLAP                                        
DUPLICATE KEY(`k1`, `k2`)
COMMENT 'test table1'          
PARTITION BY RANGE(`k1`)           
(PARTITION p01 VALUES [("-2147483648"), ("10")),
PARTITION p02 VALUES [("10"), ("100"))) 
 DISTRIBUTED BY HASH(`k1`) BUCKETS 1
PROPERTIES (                                                                                                                        
"replication_allocation" = "tag.location.default: 1",
"storage_format" = "V2",
"light_schema_change" = "true",
"disable_auto_compaction" = "false"
);

title: [Feature](index) support token_bf index for token search
body: # Proposed changes **Support token_bf index for token search:** 1. Token_bf index is mainly used to optimise English text searching accurately. It can split sentences by non-numeric and non-characters and construct bloom filter. When searching by like、not like、startsWith、in、not in、endswith, it can accelerate searching time. This pr is only support like. 2. vs ngram_bf index, In English text (1) Token_bf index has 100% up. (2) It doesn't need to provide ngram_size parameter. 3. vs inverted index support case sensitive and escape character 4. Limitation In like '%xxx%' sql, token_bf index will not be used. Because the bloom filter records the whole token and it can't process part of it. We can use like '% xxx %' or hastoken(xxx) function to process. **Test:** 2kw data, BUCKETS 1 ``` CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS hits_url4 ( UserID int, url text DEFAULT '', url_ngram3 text DEFAULT '', url_ngram6 text DEFAULT '', url_token text DEFAULT '', url_inverted text DEFAULT '', INDEX idx_ngrambf (`url_ngram3`) USING NGRAM_BF PROPERTIES("gram_size"="3", "bf_size"="1024") COMMENT 'url_ngram ngram_bf index', INDEX idx_ngrambf2 (`url_ngram6`) USING NGRAM_BF PROPERTIES("gram_size"="6", "bf_size"="1024") COMMENT 'url_ngram ngram_bf index', INDEX url_token (`url_token`) USING TOKEN_BF PROPERTIES("bf_size"="1024") COMMENT 'url_token_bf index', INDEX idx_inverted (`url_inverted`) USING INVERTED PROPERTIES("parser"="english") COMMENT 'url_inverted index' ) DUPLICATE KEY(UserID) DISTRIBUTED BY HASH(UserID) BUCKETS 1 PROPERTIES("replication_num" = "1") ``` | index type | speed | up | |--------|--------|--------| | none | 0.76s | - | | ngram_bf gram=6 | 0.56s | 36% | | ngram_bf gram=3 | 0.17s | 347% | | token_bf | 0.08s | 850% | Issue Number: close #xxx ## Problem summary Describe your changes. ## Checklist(Required) * [ ] Does it affect the original behavior * [ ] Has unit tests been added * [ ] Has document been added or modified * [ ] Does it need to update dependencies * [ ] Is this PR support rollback (If NO, please explain WHY) ## Further comments If this is a relatively large or complex change, kick off the discussion at [dev@doris.apache.org](mailto:dev@doris.apache.org) by explaining why you chose the solution you did and what alternatives you considered, etc...

title: [fix](function) Support more behaviors of cast time in MySQL
body:
# Proposed changes
fix https://github.com/apache/doris/pull/18565  Some MySQL behaviors that still need to be supported.
**before**
```
mysql [(none)]>select cast('2023-02-02 19:18:17' as time);
+-------------------------------------+
| CAST('2023-02-02 19:18:17' AS TIME) |
+-------------------------------------+
| NULL                                |
+-------------------------------------+
```

**affter**

```
mysql [(none)]>select cast('2023-02-02 19:18:17' as time);
+-------------------------------------+
| CAST('2023-02-02 19:18:17' AS TIME) |
+-------------------------------------+
| 19:18:17                            |
+-------------------------------------+

```
## Problem summary

In the past, the "time" type was stored using double, but later additional date types were added. The problem is that we do not allow users to use the "time" type
```
ERROR 1105 (HY000): errCode = 2, detailMessage = Unsupported type: TIME
```
it is only used internally in the program. 
May be we need to **refactor** the code?

## Checklist(Required)

* [ ] Does it affect the original behavior
* [ ] Has unit tests been added
* [ ] Has document been added or modified
* [ ] Does it need to update dependencies
* [ ] Is this PR support rollback (If NO, please explain WHY)

## Further comments

title: [feature](geometry) Support geometry type
body:
Support geometry type, Store geo data in wkb format, query by hex string

```sql
mysql> create table geo_test
    -> (
    ->     id int,
    ->     geodata geometry
    -> )
    -> DUPLICATE KEY(`id`)  
    -> DISTRIBUTED BY HASH(id)
    -> PROPERTIES
    -> (
    ->     "replication_num" = "1"
    -> );
Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.08 sec)

mysql> insert into geo_test values (1,"POINT(1 1)");
Query OK, 1 row affected (0.12 sec)
{'label':'insert_b5ad629d23754ae3_a0dae3afbe5ebfe8', 'status':'VISIBLE', 'txnId':'1002'}

mysql> select * from geo_test;
+------+--------------------------------------------+
| id   | geodata                                    |
+------+--------------------------------------------+
|    1 | 0101000000000000000000f03f000000000000f03f |
+------+--------------------------------------------+
1 row in set (0.07 sec)
```

title: [fix](planner)Nereids support cancel query
body:
# Proposed changes
User cancel a query 
    -> throws NereidsException 
        -> using same queryid to executeByLegacy
            -> A new query with new slotid could be send to be
                    -> The new query using old queryid find old tuple which cached in be 
                       -> new query's slotid can not match old, then prepare failed

# Solution
When user cancel a query, fe should return directly.

## Checklist(Required)

* [x] Does it affect the original behavior
* [ ] Has unit tests been added

title: [fix](parquet) hasn't initialize select vector when number of nested values equals zero
body:
# Proposed changes
Fix bug when reading array type in parquet file:
```
ERROR 1105 (HY000): errCode = 2, detailMessage = [INTERNAL_ERROR]Read parquet file xxx failed,
reason = [IO_ERROR]Decode too many values in current page
```
When reading normal columns, `ScalarColumnReader::_read_values` still calls `ColumnSelectVector::set_run_length_null_map` to initialize select vector, but `ScalarColumnReader::_read_nested_column` hasn't do this, making the number of values wrong. The situation where this error occurs is particularly extreme: The column pages have remaining values to be read, but all of them are null values at ancestor level, so there's no actual read operation, just skipping null values at ancestor level.

## Checklist(Required)

When setting global variables from Non Master FE, there will be error like:

`Variable 'password_history' is a GLOBAL variable and should be set with SET GLOBAL`

Because when setting global variables from Non Master FE, Doris will do following step:

1. forward this SetStmt to Master FE to execute.
2. Change this SetStmt to "SESSION" level, and execute it again on this Non Master FE.

But for "GLOBAL only" variable, such ash "password_history", it doesn't allow to set on SESSION level.
So when doing step 2, "set password_history=xxx" without "GLOBAL" keywords will throw exception.
So in this case, we should just ignore this exception and return.
